title: L.A. County Arboretum in Arcadia closed after mother bear, cubs spotted on grounds
dc:creator: Nathan Solis
description: The bears were spotted sleeping at the 127-acre arboretum in Arcadia, forcing an evacuation.
content:encoded: The bears were spotted sleeping at the 127-acre arboretum in Arcadia, forcing an evacuation.

media:content.media:description: ARCADIA, CA - MAY 08: A peacock hangs out near a closed wooden bench at the Los Angeles County Arboretum & Botanic Gardens on Friday, May 8, 2020 in Arcadia, CA. The Arboretum & Botanic Gardens is currently open to the public, and visitations can be scheduled on line. Pedestrians are let in the park on a timer to ensure social distancing. The paved roads are open to the public, while the smaller trails are closed, as social distancing cannot be practiced. (Gabriella Angotti-Jones / Los Angeles Times)
